data.title: Good and quiet place to meet
data.text: I was a little surprised that there were very few people eating when we went the other day and it was good but not pronominal as I was told.  Will eat there again to give another chance to impress me.

owner_response.author: fkt2014, Owner at Maximillians Grill & Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Please come join us again!  We want every experience to be beyond expectations.  Feel free to call and speak with Will or Margie 919-465-2455 so we can make certain you are impressed!  Thank you so much for the feedback!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Inadequate attention to detail
data.text:
My husband, two adult sons and I had dinner at Maximillian's Grill on a Saturday evening. We had an early reservation made through Open Table.  We were seated upstairs in a dark and rather unattractive environment. There were several tables downstairs in a lighter and more appealing setting that remained open the entire time that we were there.  We had studied the menu on-line before deciding to dine there.  However, when we arrived and saw the menu on site, we saw that items listed in the online menu were no longer available on-site.  The server explained the menu had changed and had not been updated on-line. Really? This is not acceptable.

We ordered a charcuterie and cheese platter that had a rather average selection. There was no bread with the platter.  The presentation was almost haphazard, like something you would throw together at home.  The plate was too large for the amount of food.  This problem carried through to the main course.  My husband ordered one of the specials, lamb.  The meat was well seasoned. The portion of meat was large although about a third of it was fat.  There were almost no vegetables with the meat.   My sons had the salmon which they liked.  There was no salt or pepper on the table, however, which was another oversight.  I had the Korean barbecue which was the best dish of the four that we ordered.  The seasoning was excellent.

I think this restaurant has the potential to be quite good.  However, at its current level of performance, it does not merit the price charged. We paid around $50 a person and for that amount, we could have been at Saint Jacques in Raleigh and had a much superior meal.  Maximillian's needs to amp up their game, get that website updated and improve their presentation skills.

owner_response.author: fkt2014, Owner at Maximillians Grill & Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for the feedback.  I am sorry you did not care for the décor or seating in our loft.  We are perplexed as to what website you looked at, as our menu is current on our website, Yelp, Trip Advisor and Opentable.  That being said, we apologize for any confusion.  Our menu changes with what is current and in season.  
By no means is our food, presentation or service inadequate, and as working owners, we stand by that.  Like Mother would say, "not everyoone is going to like you".   As for the lamb dish, we don't have a lamb dish on the menu, nor have we since we opened in April.       
We are sorry to disappoint you.
Best Regards
Will & Margie Hennessee
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Still Cannot Get It to be Good Restaurant
data.text: Food was spicy, too spicy, not that appealing, and the wait staff were not that helpful or pleasant.

owner_response.author: Maximillians333, Owner at Maximillians Grill & Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: As owners, it is always disappointing to see such feedback. We are sorry to hear that your evening did not meet your expectations.  We appreciate your comments, and if you are compelled to return, we would love to have you as our guest, and hopefully we can make things more enjoyable for you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dave Kelly
data.text: This is the best restaurant in Cary. New owners and long time employees recently took over. I'm a server/ bartender in harbor town on Hilton Head Island and Margie taught me everything I know about good wine and food. Will is the man! Wilson the chef executes dishes better than Gordon Ramsey. Life changing experience. Cudos!

data.title: EXCELLENT FOOD AND SERVICE - -- OTHER AREAS NEED SOME TWEEKING
data.text:
I must tell you that the food was terrific and the wait staff couldn't be better. There are two things that need severe addressing. First the noise factor was awful due to the lack of drapes or acoustic ceiling tile and some form of sound absorbent materials. Second the server had a list of specials that took forever to go through plus the new wines  and  their flavorings. I would strongly suggest that these items be printed and handed to the customer with the regular menu so that the server could be more productive like waiting on other tables while the customer absorbed this information. 
 I had the duck which was terrific. I wasn't expecting a near like stew, but once I rapped my head around the dish I was OK with it. Everyone at the table were very impressed with there dinners. The home made deserts were fabulous. This place is a keeper.

data.title: A New Touch
data.text: Hats off to Margie and her husband Will!  My husband and I have been going to Maximillians for over 20 years.  We have lived through it's evolution,but I have to say they nailed it.  Great job! The atmosphere is cozy, comfortable and personal. Pictures of their family hang on one wall and grandma's china on another.  The colors are soft and peaceful.  The menu is varied, having some of the old  favorites like the voodoo tuna, my husband's favorite.   Yes he had it and love it.   We started with the mango kale salad.  It was out of this world.  Light and very tasty.  he had the tuna and I had the Salmon. The salmon  sat on a bed of greens and was accompanied with fingerling potatoes.  We had the peanut brittle gelato  for dessert.  Yummy.  All desserts are made in house.  the servers were friendly and attentive.  Will definitely  be back!

data.title: Very enjoyable evening out
data.text: We were visiting relatives in Cary and they took my husband and me to Maximillians for dinner. From what I was told the workers purchased the restaurant from the original owner when they heard it was being put up for sale. The enthusiasm of the entire staff was very upbeat and enthusiastic and the food was delicious. I ordered a single veal chop that was on the specials and it was prepared perfectly, topped with a mushroom sauce and accompanied by round potato balls. The men in our party opted for the salmon and both agreed it was prepared exactly as requested. And the 4th member of our party selected the soft-shell crab special which looked delicious and tasted even better. They were so large she took one home with her. For dessert we shared a generous slice of chocolate cake (sinful) and a slice of moist delicate coconut cake. The service was attentive without being intrusive. We sat upstairs but if you have any difficulty climbing stairs, definitely request a table either on the first floor or, in nice weather, outside. I recommend this restaurant without hesitation.

data.title: Revisit
data.text: Same place, same great food.  My compliments to keeping a wonderful restaurant going.  I'll bring my good friends to eat!

data.title: Unique food
data.text: Love the Voodo Tuna and desserts. Excellent service, wine list and coffee.  Appetizers are fresh and some of the best calamari I have ever had.

data.title: Excellent as usual!
data.text: Maximillions has been one of our favorites for many years.  Tonight I had my second dinner there in the past two weeks.  I was trying to squeeze in as many great experiences here as possible before the departure of Gail and Michael.  My wife and I had our favorite salad, the pear and gorgonzola, followed by the boneless beef spare ribs and the pork tenderloin.  Both were fantastic.  We even split the carrot cake for dessert.  We can only hope that some of the magic will remain once the founders depart.  Best of luck to Gail and Michael, it has been fantastic dining with you in the various incarnations of the restaurant.

data.title: Pleasant Evening
data.text: A business client and I met at Maximillians recently for dinner.  It was a favorite of hers and I had never been there.  Both dinner and service were very good.  She had the pork chop and declared it excellent and the serving size was large enough to take some home.  I had a fish special and it was light, flavorful and just the right amount to eat.  Our server was attentive and did not rush us even though we were there for a while.  I would definitely return only next time I won't sit at a small table like that.

data.title: Bw
data.text: Sauce on short ribs was too much quantity.   Cut back to 25 or 50 percent to make perfect.  The ribs themselves were perfect.  Just to much sauce.   All else was great.  Double shots of bourbon are generous.

data.title: Beautifully creative cuisine
data.text: It was very difficult to decide what to order from this amazing menu. We considered ordering several starters in place of a meal, but finally determined to go with 2 entrees and the bread plate. First of all let me say, this is no ordinary bread plate. By far, this is the best appetizer value for money in the triangle! For $3.95 you get a generous portion of homemade focaccia topped with pesto, olive oil and mozzarella. It's served with shaved Parmesan and green olive tapenade all surrounded by a drizzle of balsamic glaze. It's beauty was rivaled only by its taste! Amazing! For entrees we chose the short ribs and the phyllo encrusted salmon both of which far exceeded our expectations. The combinations were truly innovative and the presentations stunning. This was definitely the best meal we have had in a long time.

data.title: Four for Four
data.text: We took friends from Charleston, SC. 6:00, Wed nite.  Only four other people so it was very quiet & pleasant.  We ordered four different entrees & all were great.  The ladies couldn't eat theirs so lunch was assured.  Be sure to read the ingredients eg the Voodoo Tuna - you have to like ginger.  Chef Michael's sauces make the dishes.  Gail always makes you welcome

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: You have to try the phylo-dough wrapped salmon filet with grilled squash and roasted new potatoes.   We had the sesame  calamari with general tso's sauce as an appetizer. Service was good and or waiter recommended a good wine.

data.title: Great place
data.text: The food, service and atmosphere were over the top. Fantastic menu, I wanted to order half the menu. Started off with the chicken wraps, followed up with the lamb rack special and the Paella. Pecan pie for dessert. Great server, I could eat here every week. If you get a chance, give it a try!

data.title: Enjoyed it in the past but...
data.text: We've been to Maximillions a few times in the past and it had been a few years. I started with a delicious salad with a bacon vinaigrette, but the meal went downhill from there. Our entree with risotto and seared scallops was decent, but seemed overpriced. We shared a creme brûlée for dessert, but the inside was way over cooked and the top was burnt. We sent it back & they took it off the check. I thought the pour of wine I got was small, and initially we sat down to a table that still had food on the fork.

data.title: good food
data.text: my girl friend and i split calamari, a salad and boneless beef shot ribs.  there was a lot of food.  she had a glass of wine and the bill with tip and tax was $65.00.  we had a groupn for $30.00.  so the meal really cost $50.00.

data.title: Top notch restaurant with great service and even better food
data.text:
My friend who is local to the Cary, NC area took me to this restaurant a few weeks ago.  Being from the Northeast with access to many top New York/Philly restaurants, I am always skeptical of unassuming local places I have not heard of.

This restaurant blew me away with it's innovative menu, food quality and overall experience.  I would highly recommend anyone who is in the Raleigh, NC area search this place out to enjoy a great meal

data.title: Off Night Maybe?
data.text: I've seen a lot of glowing reviews for this restaurant, but I won't be adding another.  This was a definite miss for me.  The server was making excuses from the moment we sat down -- and bluntly said, "You're just going to have to bear with me because we're so busy."  And it went downhill from there.  Slow.  And not worth the wait.  The menu showed sparks of creativity, but nothing seemed to live up to expectations.  And to make matters worse, we were right next to a table of 20 that was so loud it became unbearable.
